page.title: 08HARLESTON,ONEHOUSE CHURCHES
page.content: Onehouse church was built some way from the road and is dedicated to St. John the Baptist.It has a round tower which dates from the Saxon period.The tower has 2 bells which bear the dates 1604 and 1673.It was used as a watch tower in case of Viking attacks.The tower was built first,with the church added on afterwards.There is a service every other Sunday at which the congregation is about 30. Harleston church is one of the few churches that doesn't have electricity but uses candles.It has a thatched roof,and has a congregation of about 20.Outside it,there are 5 metal crosses representing a family who died of scarlet fever,who were too poor to afford non-rusting metal as crosses.
